Description: Papyrus written with black ink with administrative text. 12 lines on recto and 7 on verso; this is is the upper part of EA 10341 (R. J. Demaree, pers. comm.) Thompson's MS Catalogue (numbered as 10118 E): "recto. 11 ll. accounts relating to priestly phylae. verso. 7 ll. accounts [...] Date. Persian. prob. Darius. Origin. uncertain". The recto is a fragment of a grain rations account.; the verso a brief lists of lay-priests in Ramessid hierartic, presumably from Deir el-Medina (R. J. Demaree pers. comm.).
Curator's comments: Being studied by R. J. Demaree (Leiden).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381215) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381215)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
